text: thanks!

Hi, does anyone know where I can find metadata about the Canton Coin token, such as name, symbol and decimals?
I tried using the API endpoint `/registry/metadata/v1/instruments` from this OpenAPI spec: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/token-standard/splice-api-token-metadata-v1/openapi/token-metadata-v1.yaml#L31>.
When I called the API, I received the following response:
```{
  "instruments": [
    {
      "id": "Amulet",
      "name": "Amulet",
      "symbol": "Amulet",
      "totalSupply": null,
      "totalSupplyAsOf": null,
      "decimals": 10,
      "supportedApis": {
        "splice-api-token-metadata-v1": 1,
        "splice-api-token-allocation-v1": 1,
        "splice-api-token-transfer-instruction-v1": 1,
        "splice-api-token-holding-v1": 1,
        "splice-api-token-allocation-instruction-v1": 1
      }
    }
  ],
  "nextPageToken": null
}```
Additionally, I looked into the Splice Wallet frontend. It appears to use a config with `amuletName` to display "Canton Coin" here: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/wallet/frontend/src/components/Hero.tsx#L43>.
The Splice Wallet frontend configuration is located here: <https://github.com/hyperledger-labs/splice/blob/main/apps/wallet/frontend/public/config.js#L29>.

text: To lay my perspective on the table I think it would be a shame if DA were to do that. Every developer is going to have to write some version of `@daml/ledger` . I’d encourage you to at least move it to an open source or community repo.

text: Leonid i think my original comment was not even realizing a difference between codegen and the ledger react library etc - i was kinda grouping them together in generally avoiding the javascript libraries because of the commonjs problem - my mind just went to the idea that if it's an http api to the ledger than i can just focus on interacting with that, which is more intuitive to me having zero experience developing daml or canton apps before, so it'd get me closer to having something working within my realm of comfort

attachments.text: React framework to interact with a Daml ledger. Latest version: 2.10.1, last published: a month ago. Start using @daml/react in your project by running `npm i @daml/react`. There are no other projects in the npm registry using @daml/react.

text:
Hi All,

Are there any non-native tokens currently live on Canton mainnet? I know as of 6/25 support was added, but I don't believe tokens have been launched yet.

If there are, could someone please provide details on how we could go about swapping for a small amount? We are looking to add to our partyId so we can obtain a live example on mainnet in order to build out support for customers in pulling this type of transaction history for tokens. CC: <@U02SR6E8Z9S> <@U0PQ8E25D>

elements.text:
Hi All,

Are there any non-native tokens currently live on Canton mainnet? I know as of 6/25 support was added, but I don't believe tokens have been launched yet.

If there are, could someone please provide details on how we could go about swapping for a small amount? We are looking to add to our partyId so we can obtain a live example on mainnet in order to build out support for customers in pulling this type of transaction history for tokens. CC:

text: Correct, yes

Brale has launched a number of stablecoins in the past 6 months on mainnet. There are also other assets folks have deployed on Canton.

We use a number of non-CC tokens everyday on Canton. Happy to help if that's what you mean!

elements.text:

text: Hey <@U02NR3F464V>, how can we use your stablecoin on Canton? Also, how does minting / redemption work? I tried to find more information online but I couldn't find much. Any pointers would be great

text: Are you all onboarded?
If so - Just log in and use it :slightly_smiling_face: PartyID is on the accounts like any other wallet.

elements.text: If so - Just log in and use it
PartyID is on the accounts like any other wallet.

text: minting and redemption is just like USDC. You wire in or fund onchain and it just works instantly.
